answers.answer: Hi!Well, to gain weight, you need to increase your protein and carbohydrate component of meal and eat healthy fat in moderate amount. You should continue to eat fruits and vegetables. Calculate your BMR from any calculator on the net and plan out a diet chart based on the required calorie count. You can choose your own options from various free calorie counters. MedHelp too has these calorie counters. You can track your weight on MedHelp too.Other than this diabetes, hyperthyroidism, gut problems causing poor absorption and worms in stool all cause weight loss or could be responsible for your inability to gain weight. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I'm 19, 5"3, and weigh maybe 89 Ibs. I'll be brief.
